error.offline: The backend is currently offline! Please contact support@midata.coop if the problem persists.
error.internal: An internal error occured. Please contact support@midata.coop if the problem persists.
error.internal_db: An internal database error occured. Please contact support@midata.coop if the problem persists.
error.noconsent: No active consent that allows to add data for target person.
error.notrialuser_detail: In order to use this feature you need to complete your registration. Request a written copy of the AGB and return it signed. You will also receive a confirmation code to verify your postal address. If you want to check your account status click on your username on the top right and check the 'Account Status' section.
error.mustbemember_detail: In order to use this feature you must be member of the midata cooperative. Click on your username on the top right and check the 'Account Status' section for more information.

notauthorized.action: You are not authorized to do this action
notauthorized.fields: You are not authorized to query provided fields
notauthorized.account: You are not authorized to access this account
notauthorized.study: You are not authorized to access this study.

invalid.email: Please enter a valid email address
invalid.password_repetition: Password and password repetition do not match!
invalid.passphrase_repetition: Passphrase and passphrase repetition do not match!
invalid.string: Field must be of type string
invalid.plugin: Plugin is only for a different role

missing.credentials: Please provide a username  and a password.
missing.email: Please fill out your email address.
missing.input_field: Please fill out this input field.

unknown.space: The requested space does no longer exist.
unknown.content: Record Content-Type is not registered with the platform.

exists.user: A person with this email is already registered.
exists.member: A person with this email is already registered.
exists.provider: A healthcare provider with this name already exists.
exists.research: A research organisation with this name already exists.
exists.plugin: A plugin with the same name already exists.
exists.study: A study with this name already exists.

blocked.user: User is not allowed to log in. Contact support@midata.coop for help.
blocked.participation: Account holder is not allowed to participate in study.

tooshort.password: Passwords must be at least 8 characters long.
tooshort.passphrase: Passphrases must be at least 8 characters long.

tooweak.password: Passwords should contain of a mix of upper/lower case letters, numbers and special characters.
tooweak.passphrase: Passphrases should contain of a mix of upper/lower case letters, numbers and special characters.

expired.token: Token has already expired. Please request a new one.

no_alter.consent: Consents for studies may not be altered.
no_alter.study: Setup can only be changed as long as study is in draft phase.

instance.data: Data stored in this MIDATA instance
instance.start: Choose one of the portal from the bottom of the page to start. Each portal has its own LOGIN and SIGN UP page.

localhost.name: Local MIDATA Instance (localhost)
localhost.intro: This is a local installation of MIDATA only available from your PC.
localhost.purpose: A local installation may be used in order to contribute to the MIDATA platform and for testing purposes.
localhost.access: You may register user accounts for all four portals. Accounts do not need to be confirmed or validated by MIDATA administration. You may use and register your own admin accounts.
localhost.uptime: Whenever you run it its available for you :-)
localhost.data: Data stored in this instance will only be available on your local PC.

test.name: test.midata.coop (Test Instance)
test.intro: This is a test instance of the MIDATA platform.
test.purpose: The test platform may be used to develop and test new apps and plugins for MIDATA in a safe environment. It is also used to test new versions of the portal and backend before the other instances are updated.
test.access: Register your own developer account. After validation by the MIDATA administration you may register test account holders, researchers and health providers without additional validation.
test.uptime: There is no guarantee on availability. Expect updates of the instance to happen as needed. If possible updates are done between 12:00 and 13:00 central european time but may occur more than once a day if problems occur.
test.data: Store only test data on this instance. Data may be wiped, accounts may be deleted if necessary. Records may become corrupted by bugs. There is no backup for test data.

demo.name: demo.midata.coop (Demo Instance)
demo.intro: This is a demonstration instance of MIDATA.
demo.purpose: This instance of MIDATA may be used for demonstration purposes and training.
demo.access: You may register user accounts for all four portals. Accounts will be validated by the MIDATA administration before they are unlocked.
demo.uptime: This instance is updated less frequently than the test.midata.coop instance. Expected downtime is once a week at monday between 12:00 and 14:00 central european time
demo.data: Store only test and demo data on this instance. There is no backup for test data.

ch.name: ch.midata.coop (MIDATA Switzerland)
ch.intro: This is the MIDATA platform for Switzerland.
ch.purpose: This is the productive MIDATA platform for storing health data in switzerland.
ch.access: New user accounts have feature restrictions. Healthprovider, research and development accounts can only be used after validation by the MIDATA office. Fake or test accounts are not allowed and will be blocked.
ch.data: This instance is for storing real data about real people. Data is backed up up on a daily basis.

registration.agb2: I accept the terms and conditions

lostpw.title: Password Assistance - Step 1
lostpw.description: Enter the e-mail address associated with your account, then click Continue. We'll email you a link to a page where you can easily create a new password.
lostpw.success: We have sent you an email with instructions on how to reset your password.

setpw.title: Password Assistance - Step 2
setpw.enter_new: Please enter a new password for your account.
setpw.success: You have successfully set a new password for your account.

passphrase.title: Enter Passphrase
passphrase.description: Your account is protected with a passphrase.
passphrase.if_lost: If you lost your passphrase contact support@midata.coop

postregister.title: Welcome to MIDATA
postregister.description: Before you can use your account your identity needs to be verified:
postregister.email_instructions: 1. Your email address needs to be confirmed. An activation mail has been sent to your account. Just click on the link in this mail to confirm your email address.
postregister.contract_instructions: 2. A contract has been sent to your postal address. Return it signed to MIDATA.
postregister.code_intructions: 3. A letter with a confirmation code will be sent to your postal address. Enter this confirmation code to access the platform.
postregister.code_later: Confirmation code may be entered here after signed contract has arrived at MIDATA office.

changepassphrase.title: Change Passphrase
changepassphrase.description: A passphrase is an additional protection for your data. It is not stored on our servers but is required for decrypting your data. It is impossible to read your records (unless shared with another account) if the passphrase is not provided.
changepassphrase.if_unprotected: If your account is not yet protected by a passphrase leave the old passphrase field empty.
changepassphrase.keep_passphrase_safe: Please keep your passphrase at a save place as there is no recovery function for it. If you ever loose your passphrase you need to contact support@midata.coop.
changepassphrase.repeat_finalizes: By repeating your new passphrase you make the change final.

market.no_spotlighted_plugins: There are no spotlighted plugins yet.
market.no_recommendations: We have no recommendations for you yet.

newconsent.title: Create a new consent
newconsent.name: How should this consent be named?
newconsent.type: What type of consent do you want to create?
newconsent.share_with_members: I want to share data with other MIDATA account holders.
newconsent.share_with_provider: I want to share data with a health professional.
newconsent.use_passcode2: I do not know yet to whom I want to share the data. Please add a passcode to this consent that I can give to a health professional of my choice.
newconsent.which_persons: With which persons(s) do you want to share data?
newconsent.reshare2: The person(s) authorized with this consent may reshare the data I gave them access to.
newconsent.share_what: What data do you want to share?
newconsent.consent_empty: This consent is empty at the beginning. You can select the data you want to share with this consent afterwards.

editconsent.title: Consent
editconsent.name: Name of Consent
editconsent.password_exists: A password has been set if you need to relogin with the app.
editconsent.password_shown: Use your email address and this password for login:
editconsent.people: With which persons(s) do you want to share data?
editconsent.consent_empty: This consent does not share any data at the moment.
editconsent.type_circle: This consent shares data with other MIDATA account holders.
editconsent.type_healthcare: This consent shares data with healthcare professionals.
editconsent.type_studyparticipation: This consent shares data with research for use in a study.
editconsent.type_externalservice: This consent shares data with a mobile app or external service.
editconsent.status_expired: This consent is expired. Data is no longer shared.
editconsent.status_unconfirmed: This consent needs confirmation by its owner.
editconsent.status_rejected: This consent has been rejected by its owner.
editconsent.shares_group: Shares all records belonging to group: {{ group }}
editconsent.excludes_group: Excluded are records belonging to group: {{ group }}

consents.title: Consents
consents.description: Using consents you can grant others (healthcare professionals, friends, research...) access to some of your data. Use this page to manage your existing consents or to create a new one.
consents.name: Name

records.title: My Data
records.share_instructions1: Please use the 'share' and 'unshare' buttons to select which records you want to share with consent
records.share_instructions2: This consent currently shares data with
records.delete_instructions5: on the delete button to the right of the record.
records.delete_instructions6: In order to permanently delete all records of a certain category double click on the delete button to the right of the category.

dashboard.mydata_text: Manage your health data. Enter new data and visualize existing data.
dashboard.social_text: Share your data with friends. Communicate with people sharing your health situation. Motivate yourself by competition with others.
dashboard.research_text: Participate in studies. Inform yourself about ongoing research.
dashboard.health_text: Share data with your doctor. Search for health professionals.
dashboard.newrecords_teaser: There are no new records. Visit the records page to browser all of your records.
dashboard.newsharedrecords_teaser: Other MIDATA account holders may share their data with you.
dashboard.circles_teaser: Ask others to add you to their circles.
dashboard.circles2_teaser: Create Circles to share your data with others. Share with friends, family or others.
dashboard.providers_teaser: Search for healthcare providers and add them to your list in order to share data with them.
dashboard.hcrecords: Newest Records from your healthcare providers
dashboard.studies_teaser: If you want to participate in research configure your research settings. You will be contacted in this tile if you match a studies requirements.
dashboard.researchnews_text: Search for new health research publications.

addtask.survey_description: Please fill out the surveys I shared with your account.

addusers.no_contacts: You have no users in your circles yet.
addusers.no_contacts_to_add: No contacts can be added to this circle.
addusers.no_new_found: All found users are already members of this circle.
